snippet: James Fayette said the man who stabbed him with a pair of scissors Tuesday morning in Riverside Park didn’t say a word during the rampage.
abstract: James Fayette, one of victims of scissor-wielding attacker in Manhattan's Riverside Park, says man who stabbed him did not say a word during rampage; suspect Julius Graham was arrested and taken to Bellevue Hospital for psychiatric evaluation after incident in which he stabbed or slashed five people in less than ten minutes; Graham has been charged with five counts of assault and with resisting arrest.
lead_paragraph: James Fayette said the man who stabbed him with a pair of scissors Tuesday morning in Riverside Park didn’t say a word during the rampage.

headline.main: Stabbing Victim Says Attacker Had ‘a Dead, Methodical Look’
headline.print_headline:
‘A Dead, Methodical
Look in His Eyes’
